label: Petition from Anne Williams to the St. Andrew's Society
description: Petition of Anne Williams to the St. Andrew's Society explaining that she lives unmarried in Edinburgh and requesting that her annuity be paid. A postscript confirms that Anne Williams is alive and unmarried.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Petition of Anne Williams to the St. Andrew's Society explaining that she lives unmarried in Edinburgh and requesting that her annuity be paid. A postscript confirms that Anne Williams is alive and unmarried.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information contact Special Collections, College of Charleston Libraries, 66 George St., Charleston SC 29401.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 300 dpi, 24-bit depth, color. Epson Expression 10000XL. Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
Unto the President and members of the St Andrews Society.

The petition of Ann [Anne] Williams

Humbly Sheweth

That your petitioner is aged fifty years Still resides in Edinburgh, remains unmarried and Has no other dependence for her subsistence but upon the Societys [society's].

Your petitioner therefore humbly requests, that the President and members will be pleased to order payment of her annuity to Mr. Adam Tunno who has full powers to discharge the same.

and your petitioner as in duty bound shall ever pray

Anne Williams

[P.S.] Edin. 13 April 1807 These certify that to our knowledge Mrs Ann Williams is alive this day

James [Struthers?] Minr. [minister]
Richd. McLean. Elder
Robert Lucas Elder
George Borthwick Elder

metadata.value: St. Andrew's Society of Charleston Records, 1729-2001
